bibl.title: Despatch from William H. Heard to Edwin F. Uhl, July 1, 1895
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, July 1st 1895.

p.add: INDEX BUREAU REC'D. AUG 23 1895 DEPT OF STATE

div1.p: William H. Heard, to the Department of State.
Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, July 1st 95.
Hon. Edwin F. Uhle, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington D. C.

Sir: I have the honor to ask Continuance in Office of Mr. George E. Eminsang Consular Agent at (Elmina) Cape Coast Castle- Mr Beverly Y. Payne Vice Consul General at Monrovia Liberia. The continuance of Mr. Payne as Vice Consul General is conditional, I learn he is not sober. If after careful investigation I find such to be
the truth, I will make another nomination. But if I find to the contrary he will continue. Will the State Department allow this matter to remain private until I a satisfied?
I am obediently William H. Heard Minister Resident and Con. General
